intro: Licania riverae, commonly known as the Amazonian river vine, is a climbing plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Licania riverae plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various rainforest organisms.
